talk_paragraph.talk_question: <html>{ui_string:1200001}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200002}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200003}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200004}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200005}</html>
<html>{ui_string:257}</html>

$Princess Sylvania$
Haha, don't you worry! I'll show you!
And I would appreciate it if you wouldn't judge me solely based on my past behavior!

$Grand Master$
Actions speak louder than words. Show me. Maisa will give you the next test.
※ Get the next task from Manager Maisa.

$Manager Maisa$
Haha… So I'm supposed to give you the next test, right?
It was surprising enough that the Grand Master actually met with you, Princess, but I never imagined we'd be doing something like this. Anyway, shall we get started?

$Princess Sylvania$
Bring it on! What is it? What problem must I solve this time?

$Manager Maisa$
Actually, this time is different. (Shakes head.) Maya already confirmed your wisdom, so... Let's see... (Considers what to say.)
Yes, now I need you two to go to the Old Garden and get a Special Flower?
It is a yellow bulb that blooms alone and there are not many leaves on the stem.

$Manager Maisa$
It's a really special yellow flower blooming in the Old Garden. Be careful not to forget the description along the way!
※ Bring a yellow flower from the Old Garden.

${user_nick}$
Is this the flower? (Picks it up.)

$Princess Sylvania$
I think this is the flower. But... (Seems uncertain.)

${user_nick}$
This must be it. (Face expresses doubt.) But... It just seems like a typical flower to me...

$Princess Sylvania$
Would the test really be just to bring back any old flower?
I think I've actually seen this flower somewhere before... Or am I mistaken?

${user_nick}$
They called it a test, so... We must be wrong. Or is this some kind of elaborate trick?
Still, they said it was a Special Flower...
Well, I guess we can hear more details once we bring the flower back.

$Princess Sylvania$
Okay, I guess we passed the second test!
※ Return to Merca's Port.

$Person Seeking Something$
Hmm... What should I do now...?

$Princess Sylvania$
Oh, what's this? Are you looking for something?

$Person Seeking Something$
Well… (Looks at you furtively.)

$Princess Sylvania$
It's all right. I don't know what's the matter, but my friend here is more skilled than he looks.

${user_nick}$
Uh, pardon? (More skilled than I look…?)

$Person Seeking Something$
Actually... I'm a mercenary from a small village in the northwest.
The Child who controls the area is very greedy and commanded me to get a flower
that is said to be very precious. He said I could bring it instead of paying taxes this year.

$Person Seeking Something$
I came all the way here based on the rumors... But everyone told me not to go any further if I wasn't good enough.
The problem is, don't have enough money to pay skilled mercenaries to join me...

${user_nick}$
Are the Childs involved in everything?

$Princess Sylvania$
A dangerous place? Where would this be?

$Person Seeking Something$
Well… I don't know for sure, but it is supposed to be a flower with a yellow bulb with few leaves… that grows alone.
They said it could be found somewhere really deep within the Old Garden...

$Princess Sylvania$
Oh, that flower must be... (Looks at {user_nick}.)

${user_nick}$
... The one we picked, right? (Looks at the Princess.)

${user_nick}$
What are the chances...? (This is pretty suspect.)

$Princess Sylvania$
It's quite the coincidence. But, maybe we should help...? (Considers the matter.)

$Person Seeking Something$
Have you two seen this flower? (Eyes shine with expectation.)
Please! I'll do anything if you can get me that flower!

$Person Seeking Something$
If I don't bring that flower to the Child,
they will take my youngest daughter to fight in the arena.

$Person Seeking Something$
My daughter is still so young... But if I go, I'm sure I'll die. Please! (Bows head to the ground.)

$Princess Sylvania$
The arena?! How could they do that to a young child?! (Starts to get angry.)

${user_nick}$
Are you going to help? This flower is important to us, too.

$Princess Sylvania$
I know! That's why I'm not jumping the gun.
To do such a thing to children... I want to help,
but this flower is essential for Rhadames...

${user_nick}$
(Normally I wouldn't feel the need to help unless I was officially hired for the job...
But since it's involving the Childs, it reminds me of the Blue Clan and Kanna.)

$Princess Sylvania$
(Considers the matter for a while.) If it's for the children, I would normally feel compelled to help.
But... if there is only one of these flowers? We have to pass the test for the safety of the refugees of Aergal and Rhadames.
That is my first priority. But I can't bring myself to just abandon a kid to the arena…

${user_nick}$
(It's ironic. Normally I would just pass this by without a second thought.)
Then we should find a way to help them without compromising the test.

$Princess Sylvania$
... Right. Does anything come to mind? I don't know if this would work...
but if it doesn't, maybe we can use a flower from the plants that grew in Aergal.

${user_nick}$
What are you planning?

$Princess Sylvania$
First we show Maisa the flower. Doesn't just bringing it mean we passed the test?
And then we can give it to that guy. But if Maisa has to keep the flower...

$Princess Sylvania$
Then maybe we can use the Herb of Immortality that my nanny mentioned earlier?
There are other flowers too. Some were improved to grow only in Aergal.
There might be an Aergalian refugee in Rhadames who has one.

${user_nick}$
If so, then it seems like we won't have any issues, but do you think it will work?
That will buy us more time to appease MHN as well.
Considering you don't seem to have the best relationship with the Grand Master, after all.

$Princess Sylvania$
What? Not the best relationship? What's wrong with it? My nanny is just nitpicking.
And as for time... there's no helping it. We can't have it all.

$Princess Sylvania$
However, it is hard to turn a blind eye to people suffering at the hands of Childs, haha.
It must be because Aergal went through something similar.

$Princess Sylvania${sound:npc_Sylviana_qu9958_sp_01.ogg}
I think turning a blind eye to them
is like turning a blind eye to the people of Aergal who lost their homes due to the Childs.
If you disagree, I'll still go get another flower by myself.

${user_nick}$
... Ugh, I hate doing charity. (Runs hand through hair exasperated.)
But still... I don't want to see anyone else hurt by the Childs, either.
What you're trying to do isn't that hard, and you're going to do what you want anyway, right. So let's just do it together.

$Princess Sylvania$
Thank you so much! But I have to make sure of something first.

$Princess Sylvania$
This is the flower you mentioned before, right?(Shows yellow flower.)

$Person Seeking Something$
Th-that flower! Yellow petals, almost no leaves, and it blooms alone… Yes! That's the one!
Can you give it to me?
I don't have money or anything to give you, but I'll return the favor somehow!

$Princess Sylvania$
Don't worry about it. (Waves hands lightly as if to refuse an offer.) It's not like it was hard to get. But I don't think I can give it to you right away. Can you wait a little longer? There's someone who I need to show this flower.

$Person Seeking Something$
Um... Do you think it will take long? My tax due date is just around the corner...
Even if I leave now, it's going to very tight... (Tries to gauge their reaction.)

$Princess Sylvania$
What? You need it right now? Darn…? (Looks around with concern on her face.)
Then... maybe we can give up the flower and look around the Old Garden for another...? What do you think, {user_nick}?

${user_nick}$
... Are you serious? Princess, this is completely different from what we talked about earlier.
What if there are no more flowers like this in the garden?

$Princess Sylvania$
We'll find a flower somehow! I can't just turn a blind eye to this person...
I'm really sorry about the inconvenience!

${user_nick}$
Tsk, why would you bother asking if you've already made up your mind?

$Princess Sylvania$
Hahaha. Is that your way of saying you agree? Here, take the flower.
Hurry back and make sure your... daughter was it...? Make sure she doesn't suffer.

$Person Seeking Something$
Oh... Th-, thank you! Thank you so much!!! (Bows head repeatedly.)

$Princess Sylvania$
Don't mention it. Phew, let's go get another flower.

$Manager Maisa$
Wait!! Did you just give away the flower?!

$Manager Maisa$
Oh my, you really did give it up? Even though that flower was part of the test?

$Princess Sylvania$
Ugh, why are you here so quickly?
How could I just turn a blind eye to someone who was facing the threat of the Childs?

$Manager Maisa$
Hmm... Does that mean you're going to give up on this test?

$Princess Sylvania$
What?! That's not what I'm saying! Just hang on, I'm going to get another flower!

$Manager Maisa$
Where? In the Old Garden? I don't think you'll find any more there.
Princess, the flower is the important thing in this test,
so willingly giving it away like that means you have no intention of taking the test. Don't you think?

$Princess Sylvania$
No way...! Huh? Wait a minute... (Looks at something.) Isn't that...?

$Princess Sylvania$
(In a quiet voice.) {user_nick}, do you see that flower at Maya's feet? Isn't it familiar somehow?
Can you somehow get it without her noticing?

${user_nick}$
Flower? (That's… the same one from before?
What are the chances? I think I can get it while everyone is focused on the Princess...)

${user_nick}$
(Quietly goes and gets it.)

${user_nick}$
Here's the flower. (Hands over the flower.)

$Princess Sylvania$
Thank you, {user_nick}. Here, see this flower? Doesn't it look familiar?
Come to think of it, this is just a typical wildflower. That must mean
the flower wasn't the point of the test, am I right?

$Manager Maisa$
Then, what do you think was the point of the test?
I didn't ask you to do anything other than get a flower.

$Princess Sylvania$
Maybe... it was all about seeing whether we would help that person? They were part of your organization, weren't they?
It was so strange that we ran into each other as soon as we found the flower.

$Manager Maisa$
Hehe….. (Considers the response, then laughs.) Congratulations! I think you might have been a bit lucky, but...
Even so, well done! You passed the test!

$Manager Maisa$
Still, I was a little disappointed. I thought you would be a little faster to catch on. You only figured it out after noticing this flower, after all.
{user_nick}, you didn't think I'd notice you took this flower? Even though I'm quite a talented mercenary in my own right?

$Princess Sylvania$
I knew from the beginning, obviously! But even if there was only one...
I mean, even if this flower was really precious and it wasn't a kind of trap, I still would have given it to that person.

$Princess Sylvania${sound:npc_Sylviana_qu9958_sp_02.ogg}
It wouldn't make sense to turn a blind eye to someone in need
while trying to persuade you to help Rhadames!
Even an idiot wouldn't be capable of that level of hypocrisy!

$Manager Maisa$
Then I would like to ask the Princess what she thinks is important to us mercenaries.
Maya, always known for being calculating, said it was profit.
And the truth is that most mercenaries would agree.

$Manager Maisa${sound:npc_meissa_qu9958_sp_01.ogg}
But I'm different. We all seek that money so that we can live with freedom.
That's why I think the most important thing for mercenaries is liberty.

$Manager Maisa${sound:npc_meissa_qu9958_sp_02.ogg}
To be precise, everything we do is for that freedom. And it's the Childs who threaten that freedom.
They are both potential customers and a threat that could limit our freedom.

$Manager Maisa${sound:npc_meissa_qu9958_sp_03.ogg}
I think we should stand up to that threat and help one another when there is a mercenary in need.
That means taking care of each other as part of one big family so that no one's freedom is violated.

$Manager Maisa${sound:npc_meissa_qu9958_sp_04.ogg}
By helping others, you help yourself. It's a simple calculation, but it's important to keep in mind in this world. That's why I like your mindset.
People who have experienced pain know how others feel, right?

$Manager Maisa$
Of course, it's possible to have that mindset because all the mercenaries working with MHN see themselves as kin.
It's because MHN and its mercenaries are like one big family.

$Manager Maisa$
But embracing someone like that who you don't even know is different from helping those around you, right?
Mercenaries will do the latter, but we are not just goodwill volunteers for total strangers, you know.

$Princess Sylvania$
If the mercenaries of MHN think of each other that way, can't they just expand that mindset to Rhadames?
By trusting and helping out Rhadames, they can secure the freedom you mentioned that is being threatened by the Childs.

$Princess Sylvania$
Wouldn't it be at least a way to avoid the same fate as Aergal...? To stay alive and remain free?
In that sense, helping Rhadames is a way to preserve your freedom. What do you say?

$Manager Maisa$
Hmm. What you say makes sense. Considering Rhadames as family.
If Rhadames really could help us mercenaries, that would be a merit to consider.

$Grand Master$
It seems that you have been convinced by the Princess, Maisa.
But it remains to be seen whether you can persuade Hadar that way.
<html>$Quest Reward$</html>

journal.title: Maisa’s test
journal.contents:
The one who will test you this time is Manager Maisa. Talk to Maisa to hear about the test.

Merca's Port - Manager Maisa
journal.destination: (Solo) Speak with Manager Maisa at Merca's Port

journal.title: Special Flower Ⅰ
journal.contents:
Manager Maisa told you to bring back a truly special yellow flower from the Old Garden. Go find the special flower she mentioned in the Old Garden.

Merca's Port (Hirendel's Barrier) - Old Garden
journal.destination: (Solo) Get a Yellow Flower from the Old Garden

journal.title: Special Flower Ⅱ
journal.contents:
We got what Manager Maisa mentioned from the Old Garden, but somehow it looks like a common flower you'd find anywhere... Something's a bit off. Talk to Princess Sylvania.

Merca's Port (Hirendel's Barrier) - Old Garden (Princess Sylvania)
journal.destination: (Solo) Talk to Sylvania in the Old Garden

journal.title: Child's Tyranny
journal.contents:
Princess Sylvania agreed that the yellow flower looked common, but wants to go back to Merca's Port under the assumption it must be special, considering it's a test. If this flower really is common, there is something fishy going on. Return to Merca's Port for now.

Merca's Port - Person Seeking Something

journal.title: Something You Can't Just Ignore
journal.contents:
The Person Seeking Something is looking for the same yellow flower from the Old Garden. But we got this flower for Maisa's test. Discuss the matter with Princess Sylvania.

Merca's Port - Princess Sylvania
journal.destination: (Solo) Speak with Princess Sylvania at Merca's Port

journal.title: Something You Can't Just Ignore
journal.contents:
After speaking with Princess Sylvania you decided to hand over the yellow flower to the Person Seeking Something. Before that, ask the Person Seeking Something whether the flower you have is the one in question.

Merca's Port - Person Seeking Something
journal.destination: (Solo) Speak with the Person Seeking Something in Merca's Port
journal.todo_msg: Speak with the Person Seeking Something.

journal.title: Unexpected Discovery
journal.contents:
Maisa asked if giving the flower to another meant you had given up on the test. As you tried to argue against that notion, you notice a familiar flower blooming at Maya's feet. You should get that flower while everyone's attention is on the Princess.

Merca's Port - Yellow Flower
journal.destination: (Solo) Pick up the Yellow Flower in Merca's Port
journal.todo_msg: Get the Yellow Flower without anyone noticing.

journal.title: Meaning of the Test
journal.contents:
Give Princess Sylvania the flower you found without anyone noticing, a flower that is strangely similar to the one you found in the Old Garden.

Merca's Port - Princess Sylvania
journal.destination: (Solo) Speak with Princess Sylvania at Merca's Port
